com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic
Class ProlContext

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.ProlContext

public final class ProlContext
extends java.lang.Object

The class describes the prol engine context

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

Constructor Detail

ProlContext

public ProlContext(java.lang.String name)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
A constructor allows to use automatically the default prol stream manager

Parameters:
name - the name for created context
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there are problems to set default user input-output streams ('user')
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the thread has been interrupted
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if a needed argument is null
See Also:
DefaultProlStreamManagerImpl

                   ProlStreamManager streamManager)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
A constructor

Parameters:
name - the name for created context
streamManager - the stream manager for created context, it can be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there are problems to set default user input-output streams ('user')
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the thread has been interrupted
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if a needed argument is null
See Also:

the context name as String, must not be null

addMappedObjectSearcher

public void addMappedObjectSearcher(ProlMappedObjectSearcher searcher)
Add a searcher into the searcher list. The searches will be used to find associated java object for a Term or just a string name

Parameters:
searcher - the searcher to be added

public java.lang.Object findMappedObjectForName(java.lang.String name)
Find the mapped object through registered searchers.

Parameters:
name - the string name of searched object, must not be null
Returns:
found Object or null if it is not found

public java.lang.String findNameForMappedObject(java.lang.Object mappedObject)
Find the key name for a mapped object

Parameters:
mappedObject - the object for which one we are looking for the name
Returns:
the name as a String or null if it is not found

findMappedObjectForTerm

public java.lang.Object findMappedObjectForTerm(Term term)
Find the mapped object through registered searchers. Remember that only pure Term object can be used (not any its successor or TermNumber)

Parameters:
term - the term for which we should find the mapped object
Returns:
Object if it has been found, else null

solveAsynchronously

public java.util.concurrent.Future solveAsynchronously(java.lang.String goal,
                                                       TraceListener traceListener)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.InterruptedException
Prove a goal asynchronously which is represented as a String object

Parameters:
goal - the goal which should be proven, must not be null
traceListener - the trace listener for the new goal, can be null
Returns:
the future object for the new created thread
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if the string representation is wrong
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the term parsing process is interrupted
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if the goal is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the context is halted

solveAsynchronously

public java.util.concurrent.Future solveAsynchronously(Term goal,
                                                       TraceListener traceListener)
Prove a goal asynchronously. The thread will be added in the asynchronous daemon (!) thread pool of the context and can be checked through the "waytasync/0" term

Parameters:
goal - the term which should be proven, it will be proven in a loop until it fails, it must not be null
traceListener - the trace listener for the goal to be proven, it can be null
Returns:
the future object for the new created thread
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if the goal is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the context is halted

getContextExecutorService

public java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor getContextExecutorService()
Getter for the inside context executor service, it will be lazy inited when the first call detected

Returns:
an ExecutorService object which can be used for task execution

lockLockerForName

public void lockLockerForName(java.lang.String name)
Lock an inside context locker for its name

Parameters:
name - the locker name, must not be null

trylockLockerForName

public boolean trylockLockerForName(java.lang.String name)
Try lock an inside context locker for its name

Parameters:
name - the name of the locker, must not be null
Returns:
true if the locker has been locked successfully else false

unlockLockerForName

public void unlockLockerForName(java.lang.String name)
Unlock inside context locker for name

Parameters:
name - the locker name, must not be null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - it will be thrown if the locker name is unknown in the context
java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException - it will be thrown if the locker is being keept by other thread

tell

public void tell(java.lang.String resourceId,
                 boolean append)
          throws java.io.IOException
Activate an output stream for its identifier if the identifier starts with '+' it will be opened as a memory pipe

Parameters:
resourceId - the identifier of the output stream, must not be null
append - if true, the output stream will be opened for append new information at this end
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there will be any transport problem

         throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
resourceId - the identifier of the input stream, must not be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there will be any transport error

          throws java.io.IOException

java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any transport problem

          throws java.io.IOException

addLibrary

public boolean addLibrary(ProlAbstractLibrary library)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.InterruptedException
Add a library into the context and process the consult annotations of the library.

Parameters:
library - the library to be added
Returns:
true if the library has been added successfully, else false (if the library alreade presented)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there are problems to read an outside data
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the thread has been interrupted
See Also:
Consult

Parameters:
writer - a print writer to be used for output data, must not be null

findProcessor

public PredicateProcessor findProcessor(TermStruct predicate)
Find first predicate processor compatible with the predicate

Parameters:
predicate - the structure for which we will look for a processor, must not be null
Returns:
found processor object or NULL_PROCESSOR if has not found anything
See Also:
PredicateProcessor

public boolean hasPredicateAtLibraryForSignature(java.lang.String signature)
Check that as minimum one from libraries in the context has a predicate has a signature

Parameters:
signature - the signature to be checked, must not be null
Returns:
true if a predicate has been found, else false

public boolean isSystemOperator(java.lang.String name)
Check that there is a system operator for a name

Parameters:
name - the name to be checked, must not not null
Returns:
true if there is such a system operator else false

Find system operator for name in libraries

Parameters:
name - the name to be looked for
Returns:
found operator container for the name or null if there is not any with such name

hasSystemOperatorStartsWith

public boolean hasSystemOperatorStartsWith(java.lang.String str)
Check that a library has a system operator start with a substring

Parameters:
str - the substring to be checked, must not be null
Returns:
true if there is such operator, else false

halt

public void halt()
Halt the context and release its keeping resources

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the context has been halted already

isHalted

public boolean isHalted()
Check that the context has been halted

Returns:
true if the context has been halted, else false

objectAsTerm

public Term objectAsTerm(java.lang.Object object)
Allows to convert a java object into its Prol representation. null will be converted as TermList.NULLLIST Term will be just returned as th result ConvertableToTerm will be asked for Term and the term will be returned as the result String will be converted as Term Number (integer or float only) will be converted as NumericTerm Collection will be converted as TermList Object[] will be converted as TermStruct, the first element will be used as the functor (it's toString() value), empty array will be converted ass TermList.NULLLIST

Parameters:
object - the object to be converted into a Prol representation, can be null
Returns:
a Term object which is a Prol compatible representation of the Java object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - it will be thrown if the object has an unsupported type
java.lang.NullPointerException - it will be thrown if any successor of ConvertableToTerm will return null as result

termAsObject

public java.lang.Object termAsObject(Term term)
Convert a Term into its Java representation Term will be converted as java.lang.String or as an mapped Java object if it is found in the context NumericTerm will be converted as java.lang.Number object TermList will be converted as List
